Ricky asked, Jon, if those two men were in America, do you think they would have been armed with butcher knives? Well here was a similar brutality in America - Knoxville, TN. These 'youths' has an assortment of weapons. It`s only too bad the 2 White kids didn`t have guns to defend themselves. Per wikipedia: Channon Gail Christian, 21, and Hugh Christopher Newsom, Jr., 23, were a couple from Knoxville, Tennessee. They were raped, tortured, and murdered after being kidnapped early on the morning of January 7, 2007. Christian's vehicle had been carjacked. Of the four charged at the state level, three (Letalvis D. Cobbins, Lemaricus Davidson, and George Thomas) had multiple prior felony convictions. According to the testimony of the Knox County Acting Medical Examiner Dr. Darinka Mileusnic-Polchan at the subsequent trial of Eric Boyd, Newsom was repeatedly sodomized with an object and then blindfolded, gagged, arms and feet bound and his head covered. Barefoot, he was dragged outside the house to a set of nearby railroad tracks. He was shot in the back of his head, neck and back and his body was then set on fire. According to the testimony of the medical examiner, Channon's death came after hours of torture, having suffered injuries to her vagina, #$%$ and mouth. She was raped with an unidentified object and beaten in the head. It was also reported that her body was scrubbed with bleach which was also poured down her throat, in an attempt by her attackers to remove DNA evidence, while Channon was still alive. She was then bound with curtains and strips of bedding, her face covered with a bin liner and her body stashed within five large bin bags, before being placed inside a residential waste disposal unit and covered with sheets. The medical examiner said there was evidence that Channon slowly suffocated to death.

I have had VZ cell service since they started in our area at least 12 years ago and have had FIOS since they started it in our area about 5 years ago. I have had no reason to complain. I had a modem go out and they replaced it in about two days and I have had zero issues with FIOS TV or phone service. I had some billing issue early on in their bundling process but they fixed those quickly and they have been repeated. I don't know about AT&T service because I have never had the opportunity or reason to use their service.

For the same reason we don't profile Tea Brains. The difference is a large proportion of Tea Brains ARE actually liars and frauds, while only a very, very, very few Muslims actually pose any sort of threat to this country. Thus profiling Tea Brains for tax frauds is likely efficient, while profiling Muslims likely is not. Just imagine the cost to surveil every Muslim in the country in the hopes of catching a handful of people each year. There are better methods. But it is easy to see how flagging the tax filings of Tea Brains for extra scrutiny would yield a large number of frauds and cheats. Either way though, in America we believe in equality before the law and innocent until proven guilty, so we do not profile whether it makes sense (as it does in the case of Tea Brains) or not.

First, this isn't about words I choose, it is about a word you chose...racist "Whatever he was he did not deserve to get shot by Zimmerman that night." Really, has there already been a trial that we don't know about, I mean other than the one in the liberal media? You don't and can't know that for sure, it is only your self-absorbed and over inflated opinion. That doesn't make it a fact, or even worth consideration. Again with the broad brush over statements...I don't make candy colored guns, in fact I don't make any guns. "Black people, including Martin, have just as much of a right to defend themselves from armed people who are following them for no reason in the middle of the night as white people do." Agreed. And those following suspected criminals have just as much right to the same defense...and just a bit of a correction of your slanted opinion...Zimmerman is of Hispanic descent. You're calling me a hypocrite? If you think profiling is a legitimate enforcement activity then the ONLY question you should have is whether it worked or not. Don't act morally indignant of profiling when it involves *you* and then suggest we profile others when it doesn't. Especially in a case where it would clearly be inefficient to do so. I'm not the one with the problem hypocrisy problem here. I think profiling is wrong in ALL cases. But you are what you are and you demonstrate it over and over and over again. That is why people have such low opinions of you. It has nothing to do with agreeing or disagreeing with you. It's hard to agree or disagree with a hypocrite.

"And what did Obama do after 9/11/2012?" Look it up on a truthful site. He spoke on it the next morning calling it acts of terror. You like it or not that's what happened. No President in history has ever been on the ball and on top of issues first hand like this one. Too bad he has to work twice as hard for you than a white president, yet gets no credit

"suspected criminals" How on earth is a kid walking home from the store with a bag of skittles and talking on his cell phone a "suspected criminal"? Because he did so while black? You are what you are and you demonstrate it over and over and over again. "will be for you and for me an instant decision" It was not an instant decision. Zimmerman followed him for some time. Martin walked away, then ran away. At one point Martin walked towards Zimmerman's truck, walked around it, and tried to talk to him but Zimmerman rolled up his window. Martin left the road and Zimmerman followed him on foot, even though the police told him not to. Martin hid in the bushes, and still Zimmerman came towards him. Zimmerman never identified himself as a member of neighborhood watch or a concerned neighbor or anything. An instant decision? I think not. According to Zimmerman's own account Martin tried several times to get away and avoid a confrontation. Zimmerman continued to pursue him despite instructions from the police not to. You are right I am not a jury or an attorney and I do not have all of the facts. What my side wanted from this was a trial. It is your side that wanted Trayvon Martin sentenced to death, with Zimmerman alone as his judge, jury and executioner.

You forgot to mention the color/race of Lanza, and many other mass murderers of late. I wonder why. Who killed more Lanza, or these in England? All In The Family The US has entered into a contract with a real estate firm to sell 56 buildings that currently house U.S. Post Offices. The government has decided it no longer needs these buildings, many of which are located on prime land in towns and cities across the country. The sale of these properties will fetch billions of dollars and a handsome 6% commission to the company handling the sales. That company belongs to a man named Richard Blum. Who is Richard Blum you ask? Why the husband of Senator Dianne Feinstein, that's who. What a bunch of crooks we have running this country! Senator Feinstein and her husband, Richard Blum, stand to make a fortune. His firm, C.R. I., is the sole real estate company offering these properties for sale. Of course, C.R.I. will be making a 6% commission on the sale of each and every one of these postal properties. All of these properties that are being sold are all fully paid for. They were purchased with U.S. taxpayers dollars, and they are allowed free and clear by the U.S.P.S. The only cost to keep them is the cost to actually keep the doors open and the heat and lights on. The United States Postal Service doesn't even have to pay property taxes on these subject properties. Would you sell your house just because you couldn't afford to pay the electric bill? Well, the Post Office is. How does a powerful U.S. Senator from San Francisco manage to get away with such a sweet deal? A powerful United States Senator's husband is standing by, all ready to make millions from a U.S. taxpayer funded enterprise. No one in the mainstream media is even raising an eyebrow over his 6% commission on the sale of hundreds of millions of dollar's worth of quasi-public assets. Look up Blum on snopes True on Snopes:

(That's a year ago to the mathematically challenged). I'm betting good old Lois Lerner feels like it was just yesterday. I'm also betting more heads will roll before this one is over. I'll tell ya, those pesky Tea Party folks sure are dealing your team fits. I can't tell you how much fun I'm having watching you folks squirm.

"Why did they ever start?" According to the IG report, they were swamped after the Citizen's United decision and were looking for a way to efficiently identify cases of fraud. "Who told them to start or that it was OK do start?" According to the IG report, no one. Once the criteria list reached higher ups in the IRS they were immediately told to stop using that list. "Why are they still trying to cover it up?" The IRS requested the incident be included in the IG audit, and the information we have on the incident is from that internal audit. That does not sound like a cover-up. There are some questions about why it wasn't reported to Congress during the audit, but I would not call that a cover-up. If you are wondering why Ms. Lerner pled the 5th, I imagine it is because several powerful Republicans have publicly expressed that they intend to send someone to jail. "Why are they still lying about it?" What lies? This is what we're looking at with all of these scandals. The actual thing that we're supposed to be upset about turns out to be nothing, so we're talking about whether John Carney or Susan Rice or President Obama used the right word when and what that word really meant and who picked the words and why, or whether what was said was really an apology or not or what was meant or not, or whether something should have been said at a different time than it was said. No one cares, and you wouldn't either if you'd crawl out of your Tea Brain hole. What do real people care about? Make sure the State Department has enough funds to do its job and protect its workers. Don't allow these 501(c)4 organizations at all. Roll back the PATRIOT Act. As long as you avoid the real world and blame your election losses on IRS tax exempt processes or whether "extremist" or "terrorist" was the proper word for Susan Rice to use you will continue to slide deeper and deeper into the Tea Brain hole.
Dividend stability and track record are the key words.

"Is anyone and everyone that disagrees with you a Tea Brain?" No. "Is everyone that watches Fox a Tea Brain?" Not everyone. "Fox is the number one watched news network" No. Fox is the number one watched cable news network. I imagine quite a few Tea Brains spend far too much time sitting at home yelling at the TV. "you might as well join because they are going to overwhelm you soon." Yeah, I'm not too worried about that. You did manage to win enough elections in 2010 to take advantage of the redistricting following the 2010 Census. It is enough to keep Republicans competitive in the House for a while longer. But I do not see Republicans taking the Senate or the Presidency any time soon. Even Republicans are turning against you Tea Brains. You just lost the Boy Scouts, for crying out loud. What I worry about is an obstinate minority of dying people hanging onto just enough power to keep stealing from future generations and to keep our country from an advancing. "I don't belong to the Tea Party" Wow. For a political movement that is about to overwhelm us the Tea Party sure does lack for members. Not even Tea Brains are willing to claim to be in the Tea Party any more! But you are what you are: a Tea Brain. I judge you by your posts not whether you're willing to pay dues. "I don't watch Fox News" Wow! For the most watched cable news network, it sure does lack for viewers. Not even Tea Brains are willing to claim to watch Fox News anymore! But that's ok. There's also AM radio or as ltcolhen pointed out, the Blaze.

Really, that's the best you got, a cut and paste of members of the Republican Party. Lazy at best, pathetic at worst. I could begin with a list of the member of the Democratic Party in Congress, but it would be a waste of time. By 2016 many of them will be gone. Why are so captivated with whether Limbaugh passed his school classes or not. If you don't like his rhetoric then just turn him off. If he is such a nut job and badly informed in the way of the world why is it that you know some much about what he says? The MSM media doesn't quote him very often unless Obama is blaming him for one of his lack of leadership failures. You're slipping, you're posts are almost not worth the reading any longer.

Yep, I am calling you a hypocrite. There was that too difficult to understand. You talk out of both sides of your mouth and neither of them has a clue about the truth surrounding the actions of our current government.

"According to the IG report, no one. Once the criteria list reached higher ups in the IRS they were immediately told to stop using that list." This went on for over a year, there was no 'immediate' order to stop. There were told to stop when they were caught and it was made public. Why was the IG's report shared with the WH, but supposedly no one had the guts to inform the President? I understand you position that the President can't be involved in everything, make every decision; that is why he has many, many, many staffers to look for things he needs to know about and to inform him. Again, he has a hard time hiring competent folks to work for him.
